de.mslab.ciphers

Interface RoundBasedBlockCipher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BlockCipher
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TweakableCipher
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AES, AES128, AES192, AES256, ARIA, ARIA128, ARIA192, ARIA256, BKSQ144, BKSQ192, BKSQ96, Khazad, KLEIN64, KLEIN80, KLEIN96, LBlock, LED, LED112, LED128, LED64, LED80, LED96, PRESENT, PRESENT128, PRESENT80, PRINCE, PRINCECore, Serpent, SQUARE, ThreeFish, ThreeFish1024, ThreeFish256, ThreeFish512, WhirlpoolCipher

    public interface RoundBasedBlockCipher
extends BlockCipher
    Interface for all symmetric ciphers which employ a round-based encryption or decryption.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ByteArray addRoundKey(int round, ByteArray state)
      Performs a round-key injection on the state, that means, the state is XORed with the round key for the passed round.
      boolean canInvertKeySchedule()
      Some ciphers, for instance the AES, can invert its key schedule.
      ByteArray computeExpandedKey(ByteArray keyPart, int round)
      If the canInvertKeySchedule() method returns true, the cipher can invert the key schedule and reconstruct the secret key and all other round keys from one given round key.
      ByteArray computeKeyPart(ByteArray expandedKey, int round)
      Returns the part of the key which was used as the difference from the given round.
      ByteArray decryptRound(ByteArray block, int round)
      Performs a one-round decryption of the given block with the current key.
      ByteArray decryptRounds(ByteArray block, int fromRound, int toRound)
      Performs a decryption over some rounds from toRound to including fromRound of the given block with the current key.
      ByteArray encryptRound(ByteArray block, int round)
      Performs a one-round encryption of the given block with the current key.
      ByteArray encryptRounds(ByteArray block, int fromRound, int toRound)
      Performs an encryption over some rounds from fromRound to including toRound of the given block with the current key.
      int getNumActiveComponentsInEncryption(int numRounds)
      Returns the number of active bits/bytes/nibbles in non-linear operations in a given number of rounds.
      int getNumActiveComponentsInKeySchedule()
      Returns the number of active bits/bytes/nibbles in non-linear operations in the key schedule.
      int getNumRounds()
      Returns the number of rounds in the full encryption or decryption of the cipher.
      ByteArray getRoundKey(int round)
      Returns the round key for the given round.
      boolean hasKeyInjectionInRound(int round)
      Returns true, if the cipher has a key injection in the given round.
      boolean injectsKeyAtRoundBegin(int round)
      Returns true, if the cipher injects the round keys always as the first operation in a round.
      boolean injectsKeyAtRoundEnd(int round)
      Returns true, if the cipher injects the round keys always as the last operation in a round.

      • Methods inherited from interface de.mslab.ciphers.BlockCipher

        decrypt, encrypt, getExpandedKey, getKeySize, getName, getStateSize, operatesBytewise, operatesColumnwise, operatesNibblewise, setExpandedKey, setKey

    • Method Detail

      • addRoundKey

        ByteArray addRoundKey(int round,
                    ByteArray state)
        Performs a round-key injection on the state, that means, the state is XORed with the round key for the passed round. The state is updated and returned.

      • canInvertKeySchedule

        boolean canInvertKeySchedule()
        Some ciphers, for instance the AES, can invert its key schedule. Returns true, if this is the case for this cipher instance. Returns false otherwise.

      • computeExpandedKey

        ByteArray computeExpandedKey(ByteArray keyPart,
                           int round)
        If the canInvertKeySchedule() method returns true, the cipher can invert the key schedule and reconstruct the secret key and all other round keys from one given round key. This method computes the expanded secret key from (a) given round key(s), and the mentioned round.
        Parameters:
        keyPart - A portion of the expanded key.
        round - The round, in which the portion of the expanded key starts. Example: if the given round is 2, and the length of the given keyPart equals the stateSize of the cipher, then the keyPart is expected to hold the round key for round 2. The implementation of this method should then reconstruct all missing round keys for rounds 1, 3, 4, ..., numRounds, and, if needed, whitening keys for rounds 0, numRounds + 1. Another Example: if the given round is numRounds, and the keyPart extends the stateSize of the cipher. Then the given keyPart is expected to hold the round key for the last round, and more material, which is interpreted as key for round numRounds + 1, numRounds + 2, ... until its end. Such additional material is (!) used to create round keys numRounds - 1, numRounds - 2, ... .
        See Also:
        canInvertKeySchedule()

      • computeKeyPart

        ByteArray computeKeyPart(ByteArray expandedKey,
                       int round)
        Returns the part of the key which was used as the difference from the given round.

      • decryptRounds

        ByteArray decryptRounds(ByteArray block,
                      int fromRound,
                      int toRound)
        Performs a decryption over some rounds from toRound to including fromRound of the given block with the current key.

      • decryptRound

        ByteArray decryptRound(ByteArray block,
                     int round)
        Performs a one-round decryption of the given block with the current key.

      • encryptRounds

        ByteArray encryptRounds(ByteArray block,
                      int fromRound,
                      int toRound)
        Performs an encryption over some rounds from fromRound to including toRound of the given block with the current key.

      • encryptRound

        ByteArray encryptRound(ByteArray block,
                     int round)
        Performs a one-round encryption of the given block with the current key.

      • getNumActiveComponentsInEncryption

        int getNumActiveComponentsInEncryption(int numRounds)
        Returns the number of active bits/bytes/nibbles in non-linear operations in a given number of rounds.

      • getNumActiveComponentsInKeySchedule

        int getNumActiveComponentsInKeySchedule()
        Returns the number of active bits/bytes/nibbles in non-linear operations in the key schedule.

      • getNumRounds

        int getNumRounds()
        Returns the number of rounds in the full encryption or decryption of the cipher.

      • getRoundKey

        ByteArray getRoundKey(int round)
        Returns the round key for the given round.
        Parameters:
        round - The given round.

      • hasKeyInjectionInRound

        boolean hasKeyInjectionInRound(int round)
        Returns true, if the cipher has a key injection in the given round. False otherwise.

      • injectsKeyAtRoundBegin

        boolean injectsKeyAtRoundBegin(int round)
        Returns true, if the cipher injects the round keys always as the first operation in a round. False otherwise.
        Parameters:
        round - The given round.

      • injectsKeyAtRoundEnd

        boolean injectsKeyAtRoundEnd(int round)
        Returns true, if the cipher injects the round keys always as the last operation in a round. False otherwise.
        Parameters:
        round - The given round.
